t: Jeremiah 48
A Message About Moab

Concerning*p Moab: This*p is what the Lord*s Almighty, the God of Israel, says: “Woe*pn to Nebo, for it will be ruined. Kiriathaim*ld will be disgraced and captured; the*ld stronghold will be disgraced and shattered.

Moab*ln will be praised no more; in*ld Heshbon people will plot her downfall: ‘Come,*ld let us put an end to that nation.’ You,*ln the people of Madmen, will also be silenced; the*ld sword will pursue you.
Cries*ln of anguish arise from Horonaim, cries*ld of great havoc and destruction.
Moab*ln will be broken; her*ld little ones will cry out.
They*ln go up the hill to Luhith, weeping*ld bitterly as they go; on*ln the road down to Horonaim anguished*ld cries over the destruction are heard.
Flee!*ln Run for your lives; become*ld like a bush in the desert.
Since*ln you trust in your deeds and riches, you*ld too will be taken captive, and*ln Chemosh will go into exile, together*ld with his priests and officials.
The*ln destroyer will come against every town, and*ld not a town will escape. The*ln valley will be ruined and*ld the plateau destroyed, because*ld the Lord*s has spoken.
Put*ln salt on Moab, for*ld she will be laid waste; her*ln towns will become desolate, with*ld no one to live in them.
“A*pn curse on anyone who is lax in doing the Lord’s*s work! A*ld curse on anyone who keeps their sword from bloodshed!

“Moab*pn has been at rest from youth, like*ld wine left on its dregs, not*ln poured from one jar to another— she*ld has not gone into exile. So*ln she tastes as she did, and*ld her aroma is unchanged.
But*ln days are coming,” declares*ld the Lord,*s “when*ln I will send men who pour from pitchers, and*ld they will pour her out; they*ln will empty her pitchers and*ld smash her jars.
Then*ln Moab will be ashamed of Chemosh, as*ld Israel was ashamed when*ld they trusted in Bethel.
“How*pn can you say, ‘We are warriors, men*ld valiant in battle’?
Moab*ln will be destroyed and her towns invaded; her*ld finest young men will go down in the slaughter,” declares*ld the King, whose name is the Lord*s Almighty.
“The*ln fall of Moab is at hand; her*ld calamity will come quickly.
Mourn*ln for her, all who live around her, all*ld who know her fame; say,*ln ‘How broken is the mighty scepter, how*ld broken the glorious staff!’
“Come*pn down from your glory and*ld sit on the parched ground, you*ld inhabitants of Daughter Dibon, for*ln the one who destroys Moab will*ld come up against you and*ld ruin your fortified cities.
Stand*ln by the road and watch, you*ld who live in Aroer. Ask*ln the man fleeing and the woman escaping, ask*ld them, ‘What has happened?’
Moab*ln is disgraced, for she is shattered. Wail*ld and cry out! Announce*ln by the Arnon that*ld Moab is destroyed.
Judgment*ln has come to the plateau— to*ld Holon, Jahzah and Mephaath,
to*ld Dibon, Nebo and Beth Diblathaim,
to*ld Kiriathaim, Beth Gamul and Beth Meon,
to*ld Kerioth and Bozrah— to*ld all the towns of Moab, far and near.
Moab’s*ln horn is cut off; her*ld arm is broken,” declares*ld the Lord.*s
“Make*pn her drunk, for*ld she has defied the Lord.*s Let*ln Moab wallow in her vomit; let*ld her be an object of ridicule.
Was*ln not Israel the object of your ridicule? Was*ld she caught among thieves, that*ln you shake your head in scorn whenever*ld you speak of her?
Abandon*ln your towns and dwell among the rocks, you*ld who live in Moab. Be*ln like a dove that makes its nest at*ld the mouth of a cave.
“We*pn have heard of Moab’s pride— how*ld great is her arrogance!— of*ln her insolence, her pride, her conceit and*ld the haughtiness of her heart.
I*ln know her insolence but it is futile,” declares*ld the Lord,*s “and*ld her boasts accomplish nothing.
Therefore*ln I wail over Moab, for*ld all Moab I cry out, I*ld moan for the people of Kir Hareseth.
I*ln weep for you, as Jazer weeps, you*ld vines of Sibmah. Your*ln branches spread as far as the sea; they*ld reached as far as Jazer. The*ln destroyer has fallen on*ld your ripened fruit and grapes.

Joy*ln and gladness are gone from*ld the orchards and fields of Moab. I*ln have stopped the flow of wine from the presses; no*ld one treads them with shouts of joy. Although*ln there are shouts, they*ld are not shouts of joy.
“The*pn sound of their cry rises from*ld Heshbon to Elealeh and Jahaz, from*ln Zoar as far as Horonaim and Eglath Shelishiyah, for*ld even the waters of Nimrim are dried up.
In*ln Moab I will put an end to*ld those who make offerings on the high places and*ld burn incense to their gods,” declares*ld the Lord.*s
“So*pn my heart laments for Moab like the music of a pipe; it*ld laments like a pipe for the people of Kir Hareseth. The*ld wealth they acquired is gone.
Every*ln head is shaved and*ld every beard cut off; every*ln hand is slashed and*ld every waist is covered with sackcloth.
On*ln all the roofs in Moab and*ld in the public squares there*ln is nothing but mourning, for*ld I have broken Moab like*ld a jar that no one wants,” declares*ld the Lord.*s
“How*pn shattered she is! How they wail! How*ld Moab turns her back in shame! Moab*ln has become an object of ridicule, an*ld object of horror to all those around her.”
This*p is what the Lord*s says: “Look!*pn An eagle is swooping down, spreading*ld its wings over Moab.
Kerioth*ln will be captured and*ld the strongholds taken. In*ln that day the hearts of Moab’s warriors will*ld be like the heart of a woman in labor.
Moab*ln will be destroyed as a nation because*ld she defied the Lord.*s
Terror*ln and pit and snare await you, you*ld people of Moab,” declares*ld the Lord.*s

“Whoever*pn flees from the terror will*ld fall into a pit, whoever*ln climbs out of the pit will*ld be caught in a snare; for*ln I will bring on Moab the*ld year of her punishment,” declares*ld the Lord.*s

“In*pn the shadow of Heshbon the*ld fugitives stand helpless, for*ln a fire has gone out from Heshbon, a*ld blaze from the midst of Sihon; it*ln burns the foreheads of Moab, the*ld skulls of the noisy boasters.
Woe*ln to you, Moab! The*ld people of Chemosh are destroyed; your*ln sons are taken into exile and*ld your daughters into captivity.
“Yet*pn I will restore the fortunes of Moab in*ld days to come,” declares*ld the Lord.*s Here*p ends the judgment on Moab.
